article: Lena Horne was born in Brooklyn,New York in 1917.Her mother was away for much of her  _  .So her grandmother helped raise her. At the age of sixteen,Lena  _  work as a dancer at the famous Cotton Club in New York City.After  _  voice lessons,she soon began performing there as a singer too.At the age of nineteen,Lena moved to Pittsburgh and  _  Louis Jones,who was an actor.  _  ,their life together did not last long.But they had two  _  ,Gail and Edwin. In 1940,Lena Horne became the first African American to travel and  _  with an all white jazz band.She  _  made records and performed at New York City's Cafe Society jazz club.This was the first nightclub in the United States  _  racial barriers .Many jazz clubs during this period had  _  performers,but few allowed them to watch the  _  as part of the audience. Lena Horne became very  _  .After performing at a club in Hollywood,California,she  caught the attention of  filmmakers.So with the help of some filmmakers,she soon  _  making movies.Lena Horne said that she was able to make movies  _  she was the kind of black person that white people could accept.But she said this was the  _  kind of acceptance.It was because of the way she  _  ,not because of how good she was or how hard she worked. However,through her hard work,she helped  _  racial barriers.During her sixty year career as a performer,Lena Horne earned people's  _  and respect.She used her fame to  _  social injustices toward AfricanAmericans.
